column4: hi guys... I am trying to reinstall my skrewed up boot loader using ubuntu live cd .. but I have this problem with grub shell
when I type root (hd0,1) I get this message saying "Filesystem type unknown, partition type 0xf"
but  its just ext2 file system
can anyone help me?
root (hd0,0)
then it sayd fs type is fat and not ext2.. I dont know where its getting that
and then it cant find stage1 on there.. but its there on /dev/hda1.. which is the first partition on /dev/hda
I am sure I am missing something... but I cant figureout what.
privmsg me the result of   sudo fdisk -l /dev/hda
I sent you a lot of text.. did you get it?
are you seeing my replies?
no...
i'm replying to your privmsg
hmm ... I cant see any of those...
do you have some weird client that default-ignores privmsg?
run    setup (hd0)
same result with setup (hd0)
what kind of weird install are you doing that you have to run grub by hand?
do have an easier solution?
put ubuntu install cd in, hit enter a bunch of times, reboot, done
please go to #debian for debian install help
